883829854:
[

Business Process and Automation Practice Lead

Company Name Momentum Search and Selection Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 102 views

Job description

Momentum Search and Selection is working with a leadership group who are successfully finding opportunities for innovation within a highly regulated industry. The organisation has set up an innovation council and is seeking to do things differently using design thinking, Agile, Lean start up, etc.

\xa0

The client has set up a program of work with 4 streams which are effectively “pilot projects”. We are looking for a Business Process & Automation Practice Lead who will lead coordinate & govern the business process and automation initiatives and program,

\xa0

This role combines process management, reengineering and optimisation with technology solutions to support the identification and development of an enduring enterprise framework and capabilities, to drive greater business efficiency and user experience.

\xa0

You will be responsible for establishing and guiding the practice to enable Business Process & Automation initiatives. You will develop and execute the strategy encompassing process governance, process improvement and digitisation.

\xa0

This will include creating a business case to establish the enduring capabilities to successfully run Business Process & Automation initiatives into the future. The role will work across lines of business and in collaboration with senior stakeholders to drive an enterprise-wide program of works, to establish the use case for the enduring capability.

\xa0

Your role:

\xa0

  • You will establish and lead the practice as well as ensure he coordination and governance between the Business Process & Automation initiatives including sharing and driving learnings between the initiatives to ensure consistency of practice.
  • You will work closely with the existing Business Process Lead and Business Analyst to identify and develop enduring practices and capabilities to enable the sustainable and long-term successful delivery of Business Process & Automation initiatives.
  • Develop a lasting Business Process & Automation capabilities business case, including the initial project management plan encompassing Process Governance, Process Improvement and Automation.
  • Identify, establish, and leverage capabilities to successfully drive and deliver enterprise-wide Business Process & Automation business outcomes.
  • You have a strong influencing profile and will facilitate open communication and discussion between stakeholders, supporting business decision-making process and acting as a single point of contact by developing, maintaining and working to stakeholder engagement strategies and plans.
  • Identify, assess and manage risks and constraints to the success of the Business Process & Automation strategic initiative.
  • Analyses and design business processes, identifying alternative solutions to exploit new technologies and automation.
  • Leverages, tailors and implements business process improvement methods and tools at program, project and team level in line with agreed standards.
  • Ensures that project deliverables are completed within agreed cost, timescale and resource budgets, and are signed off.
  • Ensure that strong UX principles and practices are embedded into the delivery on initiatives, including, identifying & defining user objectives, roles of affected stakeholder groups and behaviour and performance of the systems, products and services.
  • Contribute to the delivery of corporate strategic projects and corporate objectives. (as required)\xa0

\xa0

\xa0

Your profile:

\xa0

  • You have a strong business improvement / process improvement background and you are used to setting up small practices from scratch with a focus on quick wins.
  • You have a proven track record of working on enterprise-wide frameworks and programs with a view to establishing something which is sustainable in the longer term.
  • Experience with using digitisation and or automation to drive transformation or process improvements
  • Strong experience of user centered design principles and practices, HCM, Lean start up, Agile, etc.
  • Proven track record of leveraging technology to ensure process efficiency and automation.
  • Ability to influence, engage and motivate staff and management, at all levels. You are used to working to Executive level and producing steering committee reports and packs.
  • Project project/program delivery background.
  • You have performed the role of Change lead on multi divisional efficiency/improvement programs/ initiatives.

\xa0

\xa0

\xa0 \xa0 \xa0

We offer:

\xa0

This is a great role for someone who is keen to establish a practice which will enable our client to continue down the path of innovation and embed process efficiency and automation for the longer term.

\xa0

We are offering an initial 9 month contract for this opportunity.



\xa0


\xa0



\xa0

Mitchell Shire provides a supportive workplace with a real opportunity to make a positive impact on the community. The Council also offers ongoing professional development opportunities and workplace flexibility within a supportive and innovative work environment.

883718345:
[

Commercial Manager

Company Name The GPT Group Company Location Melbourne

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 252 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At GPT we are passionate about creating spaces that go beyond the expectations of our investors, customers and communities. We create value through our focus on strategic investment and management of high quality shopping centres, office towers, logistics centres and business parks and proudly own a portfolio of iconic assets across Australia.

Every day we strive to deliver exceptional results to achieve our vision to be the most respected property company in Australia. We do this by empowering our people to take initiative and create innovative solutions. We believe our commitment to invest in you is what strengthens the core of our business and keeps us sustainable, focused and passionate about shaping the future of property in Australia.

The Role

The Commercial Manager will primarily support the Regional General Manager in relation to leasing strategies for both existing and prospective tenants, as well as acting as a key interface in building matters and maintaining tenant relationships across the office community.

The principal tasks of the role include, but are not limited to:

  • Work closely with the Regional General Manager MCT in setting and implementing leasing strategies, preparation of tenant retention strategies & tenant relationship management. Recommendations are to display reference to the Asset Plan and, if outside of Asset Plan parameters, justification as to why.
  • Develop and implement effective and accurate asset plans, alongside income and expenditure budgets, forecasts and financial reports - proactively managing property revenue and budgets
  • Review and analysis of monthly income and expenditure forecasts including providing input as required for Asset Plans, Business Plans, Let Up Schedules.
  • Achievement of personal performance KPIs (as applicable).
  • Taking the lead in managing the commercial and tenant relationship aspects at MCT in conjunction where appropriate with the Regional General Manager.
  • Work collaboratively with the Operations teams from a property management perspective to ensure tenants seamlessly achieve their fitout delivery outcomes and that related Lessor works are delivered on time and within budget.
  • Management of all tenant incentives and leasing payments
  • Ensuring a high level of presentation is maintained at all assets
  • Oversee the process to ensure that there are no major risks associated with public liability, fire and lift safety, essential services, non-essential services, members of staff, management office and contractors. This includes addressing all issues within the appropriate timeframes and ensuring a risk management plan is in place for the asset, particularly covering contractors and the management team.
  • Receive a high level of satisfaction from both tenants and senior management in relation to building performance and execution of duties
  • Undertake and complete specific tasks/instructions from senior management in a timely manner.
  • Oversee the implementation of sustainability tasks and projects, with sustainability data collected, logged and reported within agreed timeframes.

Experience and Qualifications:

  • Bachelor Degree (or post graduate qualification) in property related discipline
  • Five years (post graduate) commercial or industrial property management within a major agency or other institution is desired.
  • Experience in managing leasing campaigns & key tenant relationship management.
  • Strong leadership skills, with a demonstrated ability to lead a small team.

What sets The GPT Group apart

  • Awarded Employer of Choice for Gender Equality 2017-2018 (WGEA)
  • “Bring your whole self to work” philosophy through our GPT LGBTI Awareness and Diversity network (GLAD)
  • Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion, with an established Diversity and Working Group (DIWG)
  • Commitment to First Nations Communities in creating positive change and in the broader Australian society, through our Reconciliation Action Plan (RAP) and Graduate and Intern rotations
  • Broad spectrum of diverse and challenging career opportunities available across the organization as well as investment in your personal development and future career aspirations
  • At GPT, we recognise that providing our people with flexible working options improves our performance, creates opportunities for learning, supports wellbeing and improves our lives outside of work. Our mobile workplace technologies and activity-based work environments make working at GPT what you do, not where you do it. Explore your options to achieve flexibility including: generous paid parental leave, tailored hours and flexible scheduling, career breaks, study leave, compressed hours, remote working and leave purchase plans.

GPT is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. All suitably qualified applicants will receive equal and fair consideration for employment.

What are the next steps?

Click the apply button to submit your formal application online. We look forward to hearing from you.

Seniority Level

Executive

Industry

  • Commercial Real Estate

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Management

884111176:
[

Operations Coordinator

Company Name Frasers Property Australia Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 46 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Frasers Property Australia is one of Australia's leading diversified property groups with over 650 staff and operations across Australia. Our parent company, Frasers Property Limited, is a multi-national property group that owns, develops and manages a diverse portfolio of properties across the globe, and is listed on the SGX-ST with total assets of more than S$27 billion and a portfolio spanning over 80 cities around the world.


Our Investment Property line of business is currently seeking an Operations Coordinator to join the team based in our St Kilda Road Office. This reports into and provides support and assistance to the Operations Manager in managing all aspects of building services, statutory compliance and risk management, while also providing exceptional customer service to all internal and external customers. Also working closely with the property management team, this is an integral role for the Victorian industrial portfolio.


This role is an administrative based role which presents the opportunity for an individual who is looking to build and develop their career in operations management. As the successful applicant, this role will see your responsibilities include but not limited to:


  • Recording, tracking, rectifying and closing-out all customer ad hoc maintenance items and building services issues in a timely manner
  • Ensuring all Frasers Property safety policies are implemented and maintaining service provider inductions
  • Assisting with conducting regular inspections of properties, plant and equipment
  • Assisting with preparing and tendering services agreements as required
  • Maintaining and updating site safety manuals and risk registers
  • Maintaining and managing the asset maintenance platform
  • Ensuring fire, electrical, hydraulic and mechanical services at the properties are being maintained in accordance with the service agreements
  • Assisting with reviewing and coordinating necessary approvals with the Property Management team for tenants to implement fit-out proposals, as well as assisting with the review of operational budgets and expenditure
  • As required, assisting the property management team with the preparation of the monthly management reports as well as undertaking other reporting as required (Building services operations, statutory compliance etc)

At Frasers Property Australia, we are driven by a belief that ‘experience matters’. Understanding the human side of property is our greatest asset and inspires our workplaces. We maintain an environment of equality where all staff members are supported in their efforts to achieve their full potential. We implement policies and work practices that encourage flexible work options to assist all staff to balance their work, life and family responsibilities, including our paid parental leave scheme and flexible work options.


Desired Skills and Experience

As the ideal applicant you will possess:


  • A relevant Trade certificate or tertiary qualification in building, construction, facilities management (or equivalent)
  • Previous experience in a similar role working on a portfolio of industrial assets (ideally)
  • An understanding of budgets, expenditure and managing service providers
  • Sound knowledge of essential safety measures, fire, electrical, mechanical and hydraulic systems
  • Proficiency with the Microsoft Office Suite and maintenance management systems
  • Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to maintain strong working relationships

883734914:
[

Program Co-ordinator

Company Name Sydney Film Festival Company Location Sydney, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 189 views

Job description

In the period from November to March, the Program Coordinator processes submissions to the festival and generally assists the programming team. This primarily entails managing the online submissions site (Film Festival Life), database entry (Eventival), responding to submission queries, research for programming team, and managing the distribution of screener/online viewing links to the festival’s programmers and panelists.
Once the program is confirmed (around April), the Program Coordinator's role focusses on correspondence and administration relating to festival submissions, content delivery, scheduling and classification, and maintaining the database.
A core part of the Program Coordinator's responsibilities from April onwards is the physical and/or digital delivery (including KDMs) of presentation materials (e.g. DCPs, 35mm prints) for each title confirmed for the annual Sydney Film Festival. This task involves: meticulous database maintenance; liaison with rights holders, venues and projectionists, digital delivery companies, and content providers; familiarity with technical requirements of projection; coordinating projection sheets; and careful tracking of correspondence and shipments relating to festival titles.


KEY SELECTION CRITERIA
Essential
• Attention to detail, strong organisational and time management skills
• A self-starter with the ability to work as part of a busy team
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with a demonstrated commitment to excellent customer service
• Experience of using databases within an office or event environment
• Demonstrated understanding of digital formats, protocols and projection processes
• Excellent administrative skills including filing, data entry, and scheduling
• Demonstrated computer competency with the ability to quickly learn new programs as required.
Desirable
• Experience of working in film distribution and/or cinema presentation
• Experience of working in event-based organisation


CORE COMPETENCIES
Team Focus: Is committed and skilled at working with and assisting others to achieve positive
outcomes
Flexible: Demonstrates a willingness to take on new challenges roles and responsibilities and
adapt positively to changing working conditions and priorities
Self Starting: Highly motivated to achieve, shows initiative and acts proactively to deliver excellent
results without directive supervision
Interpersonal: Skilled at building rapport, understanding others needs and developing effective
working relationships


To apply for this position, please forward a letter addressing above selection criteria along with a current curriculum vitae to jenny@sff.org.au, by 5pm Monday 8 October. Please direct any enquiries to Jenny Neighbour via email: jenny@sff.org.au.
Interviews will take place in late October and the role will commence on 12 November 2018.

At Richmond, culture is paramount and the Club is committed to developing its people in a supportive environment.

About The Role

Reporting to the Head Coach, the Assistant VFLW Coaches work closely with the RFC VFLW Senior Coach, each other and the Head of Women’s Football to implement best practice programs and policies consistent with the vision and values of the Richmond Football Club. The Assistant VFLW Coach is also responsible for designing and implementing training programs that ensure the development of our Women’s players.

Key Responsibilities
  • Implement training programs and other football aspects of the Women’s curriculum.
  • Responsible for the coaching and training of an assigned Line Group.
  • Work with the VFLW Coaching team to establish long-term development strategies for the team’s game plan and each individual player.
  • Build and maintain strong relationships with all VFLW/AFLW players, ensuring a positive experience entering, playing for, and exiting Richmond Football Club.’
  • Analyse, report and provide feedback on relevant player KPIs to the Head Coach.
  • Game-day support to Head Coach, Coaching Team and players.
  • Opposition analysis and reporting.


What We’re Looking For
  • Playing experience at either AFL/VFL/AFLW/VFLW level
  • Experience in an elite sports team or environment
  • Minimum Level 2 Coaching Accreditation
  • Previous experience at an AFL club or equivalent (preferred)
  • Proficient in Sports Code and Hudl (preferred)
  • Passionate about football
  • Ability to work flexible hours and weekends
  • Committed to delivering high performance standards
  • Optimistic and relentless in achieving goals
  • Ability to work in a team and for the team
  • Demonstrated initiative and resilience
  • Excellent communication skills and public speaking ability

# Flexibility is something we value and we recognise that this will mean different things for different people. If this is important to you, please raise this with us.

Closing Date
7 Oct 2018

Other Details

For any further information or if you have any queries please contact the Head of Women’s Football via email click apply.

This role is designated Elite Athlete Friendly meaning the employer is open to accepting expressions of interest from elite athletes who require flexible work arrangements for training and competition.

Digital Content and Distribution Lead (Full time, Fixed-term)

Company Name Museums Victoria Company Location Melbourne, AU

Be an early applicant

Job description

Australia’s largest public museum organisation is seeking a Digital Content and Distribution Lead expert to establish and implement Museums Victoria’s digital content and distribution strategy, ensuring the digital stories and content we produce meet high editorial and production standards and reach and impact the widest possible audience. The position is responsible for overseeing the production and distribution of multiplatform digital content and managing the workflow and output of digital content creators, ensuring the content meets standards and guidelines, accommodates user behaviours, drives engagement, and extends Museums Victoria’s reach online, onsite and offsite.

Digital Content and Distribution Lead

Australia's largest public museum organisation is seeking a Digital Content and Distribution Lead expert to establish and implement Museums Victoria's digital content and distribution strategy, ensuring the digital stories and content we produce meet high editorial and production standards and reach and impact the widest possible audience.

About Museums Victoria

Museums Victoria cares for the State scientific and cultural collections, providing visitor access, activities and events at five distinct venues: Melbourne Museum, Immigration Museum, Scienceworks, IMAX Cinema and world heritage listed Royal Exhibition Building.

To learn more about Museums Victoria, please visit museumvictoria.com.au/about/

About The Position

The position is responsible for overseeing the production and distribution of multiplatform digital content and managing the workflow and output of digital content creators, ensuring the content meets standards and guidelines, accommodates user behaviours, drives engagement, and extends Museums Victoria's reach online, onsite and offsite.

The Successful Applicant Will Have
  • Experience in creating and implementing digital content strategies that focus on user experience principles, human centred design techniques and agile methodologies.
  • Demonstrable experience in managing an organisation's multiplatform digital content output and a record of success in growing and engaging digital audiences and identifying content and distribution opportunities.
  • Demonstrable experience in planning and executing digital content commissioning, production and publishing workflows, standards and outputs.
  • Demonstrable experience in applying editorial judgement when producing, publishing and moderating digital content.
  • Solid industry experience in hands-on multiplatform digital content production, with demonstrable experience in story structure, writing and sub-editing, a keen eye for newsworthy content and an in-depth understanding of all phases of production.
  • An in-depth knowledge and understanding of developments in digital storytelling formats, content production and audience trends.
  • Working knowledge of content management systems and data analytics packages and common media production software.
  • Excellent communication, problem solving and interpersonal skills and experience in managing creative teams, multiple projects and delivering to deadlines.
  • An understanding of the role of museums in contemporary society and a commitment to Museum Victoria's purpose and values.


Other Information

This is a full-time; fixed-term position until 30 June 2021. The salary on offer is $95,275.00 + 9.5% superannuation.

HOW TO APPLY?

To view the position description, visit museumvictoria.com.au/employment/; for more information about this position, please contact Carmel O'Keeffe, Head of Digital Life, Museums Victoria on: (03) 8341 7305.

To apply, please attach the three following documents with your application:
  • Your Cover letter
  • Your CV
  • Your written responses to the Key Selection Criteria as described in the Role Statement

Applications Close: Tuesday, October 2, 2018.

Job description

About the opportunity

Reporting directly to the Chief Human Resources Officer, the Director Workforce Development is accountable for setting the strategic direction for the workforce development function, as well as leading and directing an organisational development team. As a HR Centre of Expertise, the role is responsible for promoting sustainable programs, policies and practices to deliver on the University’s strategy. This strategic role requires a collaborative and consultative influencer to take people on a journey of transformation and enable change. As a highly credible organisational development leader, you will demonstrate strong values aligned to the University of Sydney. Further demonstrable skills will include people management in organisational development functions and a focus on culture, capability and performance. Ideally coming from the public sector, or a similar large complex environment, most important is a proven track record of driving the delivery of workforce strategy and goalswithin a period of change and transformation.

\xa0

About you

The University values courage and creativity; openness and engagement; inclusion and diversity; and respect and integrity. As such, we see the importance of recruiting talent aligned to these values and are looking for a Director, Workforce Development\xa0who can:

\xa0

  • lead the design, development and sourcing of providers for a common leadership and management experience that promote a culture of excellence, respect and integrity
  • identify key capability requirements by job function (e.g. Heads of School, Finance professionals) and collaborating with key stakeholders to develop interventions to support capability development and support in addressing learning requirements
  • take ownership of the performance management and development solutions for academic and professional staff, with a focus on improving the staff experience and building staff confidence and capabilities to engage in conversations about career aspirations, performance and impact
  • conduct the staff engagement survey, reporting, communications and initiatives to enhance staff engagement and performance. Responsibility includes scheduling, planning, managing vendors, communicating on and deploying the staff survey on a cyclical basis.

\xa0

About us

The Human Resources function provides human resource management related advice, support and services across the university. There are three parts to the HR operating model; the HR Services; HR Centres of Expertise (COE) and HR Partnering teams. There are a number of Centres of Expertise designed to provide strategic design and consultative services necessary to execute HR initiatives identified in the Strategic Plan.

\xa0

Since our inception 160 years ago, the University of Sydney has led to improve the world around us. We believe in education for all and that effective leadership makes lives better. These same values are reflected in our approach to diversity and inclusion, and underpin our long-term strategy for growth. We’re Australia's first university and have an outstanding global reputation for academic and research excellence. Across our campuses, we employ over 7600 academic and non-academic staff who support over 60,000 students.

\xa0

We are undergoing significant transformative change which brings opportunity for innovation, progressive thinking, breaking with convention, challenging the status quo, and improving the world around us.

For recruitment-related enquiries, or if you require reasonable adjustment or support filling out this application, please contact Melanie Leshetz on 02 8627 1220 or email: melanie.leshetz@sydney.edu.au


All applications must be submitted via the University of Sydney careers website.\xa0 Visit sydney.edu.au/recruitment and search by the reference number 1815/0918C to apply.

\xa0

\xa0

Please note: visa sponsorship is not available for this position

\xa0

Closing date: 11:30pm 10 October 2018

\xa0

The University of Sydney is committed to diversity and social inclusion. Applications from people of culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds; equity target groups including women, people with disabilities, people who identify as LGBTIQ; and people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent, are encouraged.

\xa0

The University reserves the right not to proceed with any appointment.

The Clinical Operations Division encompasses acute and mental health services with a focus on excellent care, every person, every time. We provide a wide range of general medical, surgical and speciality services including oncology, cardiology, renal, emergency, women’s and children’s, critical care, specialist clinics and mental health services.

Within a state of the art hospital, the team provides high quality services using the latest technologies. Each year our onsite specialist clinics provide almost 95,000 occasions of service, we also see more than 52,000 people in our emergency department and welcome around 1500 babies into the world. 884724516:
[

Statutory Planning Officer

Company Name VicRoads Company Location Benalla, AU

New Posted Date Posted 10 hours ago Number of views 4 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Statutory Planning Officer

At VicRoads we work to make a more thriving and liveable Victoria, providing Victorians with safe and easy connections to the people and places that matter most to them. Employing over 2700 Victorians, we encourage a flexible, inclusive and diverse working environment to represent and reflect the diverse community we serve. Our staff come to work knowing every day they’re helping our community become a better place to live and visit.

About Regional Roads Victoria (a Division Of VicRoads)

Regional Roads Victoria (RRV) is a new division of VicRoads that will be solely focused on the essential role performed by the rural arterial network in connecting regional Victorians for maximum social and economic prosperity.

At Regional Roads Victoria, we make peoples’ lives better, through journeys that are safe, reliable, efficient and sustainable, judging our performance by our customers’ experience. We work by caring about people, communities and making their lives better, sharing with each other to have greater impact through our collective effort, and daring to seize opportunities and take on tough challenges. These themes shape the way we plan, consult and deliver with Victorians every day.

About The Business Area

This full time, ongoing position is located in Benalla, a regional town in North East Victoria with great weather, sporting facilities and lifestyle choices. Benalla is a central place to the Victorian Snowfields for winter activities and during the summer bush-walking. Many recreational lakes are nearby, including Eildon and Nillahcootie for fishing and water sports. You are only an hour’s drive to the Murray River and the many local wineries at Milawa, Glenrowan and Rutherglen. All this and only 2 hours from Melbourne!

One of the main objectives for the Statutory Planning area is to ensure access to any new use or development of land near an existing or proposed transport route is managed to avoid detriment to, and where possible enhance the service, safety and amenity desirable for that transport route in the short and long term scenarios

About The Role

You will be part of a diverse and skilled team with various responsibilities and challenges in planning, managing and responding to transport network needs. The Integrated Transport & Land Use Team is vibrant and thriving, and embracing the Care, Share, Dare culture of VicToads in all that we do. The team works across regional boundaries to share skills and experience with our colleagues in other regions, and you will have the opportunity to share and learn every day.

The Daily Responsibilities Of The Role Will Include
  • Exercise independent judgement to deliver assigned statutory planning programs, projects and services including review of planning referrals and planning scheme amendments, Transport Impact Assessment Reports, and assessment of strategic level land use.
  • Perform the duty of consents for non-road infrastructure works under the Road Management Act under broad supervision and assist in the coordination of developer funded projects.
  • Use negotiation and influencing skills to achieve successful statutory planning outcomes.
  • Exercise professional judgement to review plans for construction of developer funded projects, including worksite traffic management plans in accordance with established policies and procedures.
  • Provide planning advice to internal and external stakeholders that will impact on statutory decisions.
  • Exercise professional judgement to assist with the preparation and presentation of submissions at VCAT and Planning Panel Victoria hearings.

About The Ideal Candidate

If you have strengths in problem solving and customer service, you’ll enjoy the daily challenges of the role. Your tasks will include responding to statutory referrals and submissions to Victorian Civil and Administrative Tribunal (VCAT). You will regularly liaise with internal and external customers including local councils, Transport and Planning consultants and Transport for Victoria to achieve our objectives.

We are looking for an active and enthusiastic team member, with a focus on collaboration, communication and customer service. Previous experience in statutory planning or traffic engineering background would be preferred.

At VicRoads we embrace diversity and inclusion and we are proud that our workforce reflects the community we serve. We support our people to work flexibly, which can involve flexible hours, working from other VicRoads office locations, or working from home. If you would like to know more about how we could structure this role to accommodate your needs, please contact Jennifer Baldry on 0436 683 123.

VicRoads is required to evidence your right to work in Australia and may ask for your consent to check records maintained by the Department of Immigration and Border Protection as well as records maintained by Victoria Police and VicRoads as part of the selection process. Information provided to VicRoads will be treated in the strictest confidence.

Recruitment agencies – please note VicRoads does not accept resumes from third parties and will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Key Accountabilities
KA 1.


Exercise independent judgement to deliver assigned statutory planning programs, projects and services including review of planning referrals and planning scheme amendments, Transport Impact Assessment Reports, and assessment of strategic level land use.

KA 2.


Perform the duty of coordinating developer funded projects and consents for non road infrastructure works under the Road Management Act under broad supervision.

KA 3.


Use negotiation and influencing skills to achieve successful statutory planning outcomes.

KA 4.


Exercise professional judgement to review plans for construction of developer funded projects, including worksite traffic management plans in accordance with established policies and procedures.

KA 5.


Provide planning advice to internal and external stakeholders that will impact on statutory decisions.

KA 6.


Exercise professional judgement to assist with the preparation and presentation of submissions at VCAT and Planning Panel Victoria hearings.

Key Capabilities

KC 1.


Exercise independent judgement in the application of statutory planning processes and VicRoads policies and respond to planning referrals, e.g. residential access.

KC 2.


Demonstrates an understanding of the Road Management Act, Worksite Safety Traffic Management Code of Practice and AS 1742.3-2009 Manual of Uniform Traffic Control Devices - Traffic Control for Works on Roads.

KC 3.


Negotiate and influence key stakeholders in relation to business area activities to achieve desired outcomes.

KC 4.

Provide sound advice regarding leasing, licensing, issuing permits, including administrating developer funded project through consent processes.

KC 5.


Exercise independent judgement to provide sound advice to stakeholders or other staff on policy and procedures

KC 6.


Contribute to the preparation of submissions for VCAT and Panel hearings.

Prerequisites
PR 1.


Experience relevant to the capabilities of the role

Marketing Administration Coordinator

Company Name Australian Film Television and Radio School Company Location Sydney, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 2 hours ago Number of views 23 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

AFTRS is Australia's Screen and Broadcast School, established to fuel and empower Australian creativity and storytelling. AFTRS is consistently rated as one of the top film School's in the world. Our teachers and alumni include Academy, AFI/AACTA and BAFTA Award winners.


The marketing team is responsible for student recruitment and course enrolments, as well as promoting our brand Nationally and Globally.


Reporting to the Director of Marketing you will be responsible for:

  • Managing the administration requirements of the team;
  • Providing assistance with marketing campaigns;
  • Providing assistance with event coordination;
  • Monitoring and tracking the marketing budget.


If you have the following attributes we want to hear from you:

  • At least 2 years \xa0experience in a similar role within a marketing team;
  • Strong customer service ethic with good stakeholder management skills;
  • High level organisational skills with a strong attention to detail;
  • Passion and drive to build your marketing career.


Selection Criteria:


Essential

  1. At least 2 years administrative experience in a client service environment including: handling correspondence, setting up appointments, researching markets and programs, initiating paperwork and monitoring a budget.
  2. Marketing and communications campaign support experience to achieve revenue targets.
  3. Experience in event coordination and support especially in logistics coordination.
  4. Good organisational and computer skills; attention to detail with ability to work under pressure with limited supervision.
  5. Good written and verbal communications, with a ability to liaise effectively with customers and stakeholders whilst maintaining confidentiality.
  6. Proven ability to work cooperatively as part of a small, committed team.


Desirable

  1. Broad overview of and experience in screen, broadcast, culture or arts industries
  2. Sales experience in an education, screen, broadcast or arts environment.


Flexible working options are available for this role and we will genuinely consider applications for job share and part time working.


Salary:\xa0$53,758 to $60,819 p/a (pro-rata if part time and dependent on experience) and up to 15.4% super.


Please note, the successful applicant will be required to undertake a Working with Children Check.


This position is open to all Australian citizens or Permanent Residents.


AFTRS is committed to building a richly diverse staff and faculty. AFTRS actively supports and appreciates workplace diversity and we strongly encourage and welcome applications from Aboriginal and Torres StraitIslander people, people from a wide range of backgrounds and people with a disability.


How to Apply:\xa0 Please email your current resume with covering letter addressing how your skills and experience meet the selection criteria to jobs@aftrs.edu.au by 9am Monday 15 October 2018.


Enquiries: \xa0Human Resources Team - jobs@aftrs.edu.au.

Job description

Looking for a strong Operations Analyst to inform the design of a Target Operating Model - identifying process, technology, people, business and service partners


  • Long term contract
  • Ultimo NSW location


You will also be responsible for designing and implementing a Service Readiness Dashboard, suite of operational performance reports (e.g. call centre, administration, process exception, people and financial) and a benefits realisation tool that will support the SMS Program as it delivers innovative and transformative enterprise solutions.

\xa0
A bit about what you will be doing:

- You enjoy conducting detailed analyses (via desktop / primary research) and record findings using the SMS Program approach and tools in order to report findings and share insights

- Research, devise and implement a Service Readiness Dashboard in order to support the group in transforming its operations.

- Define service readiness in terms of process, system, data, people and service partners to ensure leaders are informed and have information to make decisions to be ready to accept and operate new solutions.

- Support the delivery of service readiness reporting process, analytics, and implementation and reporting for the duration of SMS R3 pre and post go live

- Support operational performance reporting for call centre, administration, process exception, people and financial (revenue and cost) in order to ensure effective business activity.

- Contribute to high level risk identification, TOM design modelling (across all elements of development and design and benefits reporting in order to support the maturation of Student Services operations

- Use the products of detailed analyses to devise and implement a range of enterprise solutions that will support the transformation of the SMS Program.
\xa0
To be successful, you need to have:

  1. Degree in relevant discipline or equivalent skills, knowledge and experience.
  2. Advanced Excel and/or Access skills to develop logical data tables; macros to automate routine tasks; statistical, mathematical and logical formulas to enrich data; and pivot tables, graphs, Qualtrics or other to present data.
  3. Advanced PowerPoint skills combined with experience in reporting and analytics.


If this sounds like you, please call Denise on 0410 678 736 or email denise@pinpointtalent.com.au
